alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, and northeastern Gates Counties, the southwestern City of Chesapeake and the southeastern City of Suffolk through 345 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whaleyville to Corapeake to Sunbury. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Downtown Suffolk around 315 PM EDT. South Mills and Morgans Corner around 335 PM EDT. Chesapeake around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Horseshoe, Lynchs Corner, Easons Crossroads, Pierceville, Savage, Acorn Hill, Suffolk Airport, Drum Hill, Hazelton and Tar Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
